summary: REQ-2 appears to be implemented via an added/expanded mainnet production deployment section in `frontend/DEPLOYMENT.md`. REQ-1 (actually performing/ensuring a successful mainnet deploy and confirming reachability/verification) is not demonstrably implemented from the provided diff summary, and several code changes (backend access control + frontend logo/public domain configuration) look unrelated to the requested deployment-only scope.

missing_requirements.requirement: Prepare and execute a production deployment for Version 30 to the Internet Computer mainnet, ensuring the deployed production canisters (backend + frontend) are accessible via the mainnet canister URLs and are not subject to draft expiration.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff summary shows documentation updates and code/config changes, but does not include evidence of actual mainnet deployment preparation/execution artifacts (e.g., CI/release scripts, `dfx.json`/canister config updates, pinned canister IDs, or any deployment output/verification results). From the diff alone, it cannot be confirmed that `dfx deploy --network ic` was run successfully, that canisters are accessible via mainnet URLs, or that post-deploy verification was performed.

hallucinated_features.description: Centralized public domain configuration with `VITE_PUBLIC_DOMAIN`, runtime hostname fallback, and helpers for constructing public URLs/asset URLs.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by REQ-1/REQ-2 (deployment + deployment documentation). This is a new configuration feature unrelated to the stated non-goal of avoiding new product features outside deployment.

hallucinated_features.description: Centralized logo URL selection logic with `VITE_LOGO_URL` override, local canister asset fallback, and custom-domain external logo path behavior.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by REQ-1/REQ-2. This is application behavior/configuration work beyond deployment documentation and may be considered a new/unrelated feature.

hallucinated_features.description: Backend authorization/admin bootstrap and email/allowed-admin allowlist mechanisms, plus site live state handling changes.
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-1/REQ-2 do not ask for backend behavioral/security changes; non-goals explicitly discourage unrelated feature work and changing backend data model unless strictly necessary for deployment.

hallucinated_features.description: Project tracking/state updates indicating in-progress/pending work items.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested as part of deployment or documentation requirements; appears to be internal process metadata rather than implementation required by the BuildRequest.
